1:
Give the king your righteous decrees, God,\q your righteousness to the king's son.
\q
2:
May he judge your people with righteousness\q and your poor with justice.
\q
3:
May the mountains produce peace for the people;\q may the hills produce righteousness.


\q
4:
May he judge the poor of the people;\q may he save the children of the needy
\q and break in pieces the oppressor.
\q
5:
May they honor you while the sun endures,\q and as long as the moon lasts throughout all generations.


\q
6:
May he come down like rain on the mown grass,\q like showers that water the earth.
\q
7:
May the righteous flourish in his days,\q and may there be an abundance of peace till the moon is no more.


\q
8:
May he have dominion from sea to sea,\q and from the River to the ends of the earth.
\q
9:
May those who live in the wilderness bow down before him;\q may his enemies lick the dust.
\q
10:
May the kings of Tarshish and of the islands render tribute;\q may the kings of Sheba and Seba offer gifts.


\q
11:
Indeed, may all kings fall down before him;\q may all nations serve him.
\q
12:
For he helps the needy person who cries out\q and the poor person who has no other helper.


\q
13:
He has pity on the poor and needy,\q and he saves the lives of needy people.
\q
14:
He redeems their lives from oppression and violence,\q and their blood is precious in his sight.


\q
16:
May there be abundance of grain in the land;\q on the mountaintops may their crops wave.
\q May the fruit of it be like Lebanon;
\q may the people flourish in the cities like the grass of the field.


\q
18:
May Yahweh God, the God of Israel, be blessed,\q who alone does wonderful things.
\q
19:
May his glorious name be blessed forever,\q and may the whole earth be filled with his glory.
\q Amen and Amen.
\q
20:
The prayers of David son of Jesse are finished.
\ms Book Three
